profile_positions.description:
Responsible for business development in: The Netherlands, Germany, Belgium, Norway, Sweden, Denmark and Finland.

Semefab manufactures microelectronics in its wafer fabrication operation in Scotland supplying wafers, die and packaged devices to the market.

Semefab is a custom wafer fab operation consisting of the CMOS1 fab, the MEMS2 fab and a CMOS3 fab.

Semefab operates both a development business model and a volume business model and can therefore support its customers throughout the full technology cycle and into volume. 

With an extensive process portfolio Semefab supports MEMS, CMOS, Opto-CMOS, ASIC and Discrete technologies. Integrated CMOS & MEMS fabrication can also be supported.

In addition to its fabrication capability, Semefab operates its own test floor supporting wafer test and package test.

As a global foundry partner Semefab exports >64% of its fabricated product.

profile_positions.description:
Primary duties and responsibilities:
Responsible for managing, growing and developing business for a major multinational customer. You work with Field Product Specialists and Account Executives to differentiate the semiconductor products and services to the customers using value arguments. You will also provide administrative and technical information to new and existing customers, provide quotations for products and services, and drive the sales negotiation process for the sales team. You work to meet assigned sales quota established for the account. 

As Global Account Manager you develop and implement sales strategies for gaining market share in target market segments using the competitive selling strategy process. You must integrate their account strategies with those of the sales organization and support operations to establish a unified multiyear perspective for the customer. You lead a cross functional team of dedicated professionals to achieve the customers goals based on this perspective. This includes driving divisional integration to reduce strategic misalignment in the account. forecasting global business opportunities to the factories, providing account status updates, and coordinating and integrating multinational sales campaigns across the sales and service teams.
You must build a solid long term relationship with all levels of management of the account. Some methods in which the Account Managers build relationships include; coordinating and hosting customer meetings both at the customer site and our headquarters in the United States. This means executing account mapping throughout the account or market segment, utilizing a total management approach to service and maintain the account, staying abreast of the semiconductor industry and latest technology, and proactively communicating new information to both customer and sales team members.
profile_positions.title: Global Account Manager

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for direct sales to the Semiconductor Industry in the Benelux, France and Northern Germany.

Directly reported to the Managing Director Leybold London UK and executive management in Cologne Germany.

Primary duties and responsibilities; 
Management of the account team, which consists of a customer care engineer and order fulfilment specialist and a service technician.
Setting team objectives, goals and plans. Both a short term (current year) and long term (3+ years) horizon.
Meet established sales and gross profit targets at key customers.
Establish and manage the critical relationship at key customers.
Develop the account profile consisting of the customers strategic plan, history, identification of sales potential, revenue and profit objectives, required resources, barriers to gaining business, identify decision strategies and milestones.
Develop the account team budget and responsibilities for EBIT performance.
Establish product qualification strategies, jointly with the customer and develop an execution strategy. Gauge and measure process.
Forecast the business at key customers, by product and sales revenue. Provide rolling or periodic unit forecast, as required by manufacturing.
Develop and tailor solutions for specific customer requirements.
Negotiate contracts and ensure terms are fulfilled.
Responsible for customer communications, customer satisfaction and complaint resolution. Product or service failures are tracked trough a resolution process and corrective action.
Establish regular meetings with customer to establish expectations, review progress add value to customer and our company.
Be knowledgeable of the customers industry and requirements. Continually inquire about new and expanding opportunities.
